news.title: Core inflation rose to 2.9% in July, highest since February
news.summary: The personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to show core inflation at 2.9%. Headline inflation was also expected to be 2.6%.

news.title: Trump asks judge to allow Lisa Cook firing without delay; Fed seeks only 'prompt ruling'
news.summary: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook is suing President Donald Trump for firing her. A court hearing could end with Cook remaining on the job while her lawsuit plays out.

news.title: Retail panic: What the end of the 'de minimis' exemption means for brands across the globe
news.summary: The de minimis exemption, an obscure trade law provision, came to an end globally on Friday, setting off a panic across the retail industry.

news.title: Fed's Waller, a candidate for chair, sees potential for half-point cut if labor market weakens further
news.summary: Waller said he believes the Fed can use its power over rates to stave off further labor market weakening. "So, let's get on with it," he said.

news.title: Trump railroad regulator Robert Primus was fired by White House after Amtrak Acela unveiling
news.summary: STB member Robert Primus made clear his opposition to the merger of Union Pacific Railroad and Norfolk Southern Railroad, a union says. Primus was removed from the board.

news.title: My friend, 61, signed a $20K contract for dental implants. She can’t afford it. Can she fight it?
news.summary: After her room and board is paid at the assisted-living home, she has $9,000 left for the year. “After her Room and Board is Paid at the Assisted Living Home, She has $ 9,000 Left for the Year’s.”

news.title: U.S. trade deficit in goods widened sharply in July as firms raced to avoid tariffs
news.summary: The U.S. trade deficit in goods widened 22.1% to $103.6 billion in July from $84.9 billion.

news.title: Americans spend a lot more on  cars in July, but not much else. Tariffs keep consumers cautious.
news.summary: Americans bought more new cars and trucks in July to try to avoid tariff-related price increases. But they spent cautiously on  other goods and services amid ongoing turbulence in the U.S. economy.

news.title: Key U.S. inflation gauge creeps higher, but not enough to stave off Fed interest-rate cut
news.summary: Key measure of inflation rose in July at a rate that suggests persistent price pressures tied to higher U.S. tariffs. But the increase probably wasn't big enough to dissuade the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates.

news.title: ‘My blood pressure is sky high’: I’m in my 70s and a widow. I pay $12K a year for long-term-care insurance. Do I cut the cord?
news.summary: “What if I become cognitively impaired and need benefits for 15-20 years?” she asks. “What will I do when I’m in that situation?’
